text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

SOYBEAN TENDER - Taiwan is seen tendering for 54,000 tonnes of soybeans this week as buyers scramble to cover their positions on expectations of a rally in Chicago Board of Trade soy futures, dealers said.
WHEAT TENDERS - The CCC said it was seeking on August 12, up to 30,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better soft white wheat for donation to Pakistan. Shipment period was slated for August 24-September 18.

WHEAT TENDERS - Morocco, which earlier postponed a tender for up to 130,000 tonnes of soft wheat, re-entered the grain market with a tender to import 90,000 tonnes, European grain traders said. Results of the tender are due on August 12.
- The CCC will tender on August 11 for 27,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat for donation to Eritrea. The shipment is August 24-September 13.
- Jordan is tendering on August 12 for 100,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat. One shipment of 50,000 tonnes is for October delivery and the rest for November, European traders said.
WHEAT TENDERS - Iraq is in the world grain market with a tender for 50,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat for August or September, European grain traders said.

- The CCC was seeking up to 6,500 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better hard red winter wheat for donation to Armenia and 6,500 tonnes of U.S. HRW wheat for donation to Georgia. Shipment was slated Aug 20-Sept 8. Offers are due Aug 5.

Armenia was also seeking about 1,000 to 1,500 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better HRW wheat in bulk under the PL-480, Title I export program, its U.S. export agent said. Delivery dates were set for Aug 20-Sept 8 and offers were due Aug 5.

DURUM TENDER - Algeria was on Tuesday negotiating to buy 150,000 tonnes of optional-origin durum wheat for September and October, grain traders said. Most likely candidates to supply the durum include Syria and Canada, they said, noting that EU durum was out of the loop for the time being.

BARLEY TENDER - European grain traders said on Tuesday Morocco was tendering for 30,000 tonnes of feed barley to be delivered between August 22 and 31. The tender is for barley of optional origin, they said.

WHEAT/CORN TENDER - The Cyprus Grain Commission issued tenders for a combined shipment of 14,000 of spring wheat and 8,000 tonnes of durum wheat for September shipment. It was also seeking 18,000 tonnes of corn due for September shipment.

RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foodstuffs (GEZA) on Tuesday issued an international tender to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for August delivery, a GEZA spokesman said.
He said that September 1 was set as final date to receive bids and that results would be announced on September 8.

VEGOIL TENDER - El Salvador was seeking approximately 4,000 to 5,000 tonnes prime bleachable summer yellow (PBSY) cottonseed oil in bulk and about 750 to 1,240 tonnes sunflowerseed oil under the PL-480, Title 1 export program, its U.S. export agent said. Both commodities were slated for October 1-15 shipment. Offers were due on August 14.

- Egypt's official Holding Company for Food Industries was seeking on August 19 10,000 to 20,000 tonnes of crude sunflower and/or semi-refined cottonseed oil for delivery in the second half of September.
